_user_ and Jordan You are half way through the lesson! # As we saw in the first section, text signals help us make predictions.
We have to make sure the text signals make sense together! # So if something is off, it may be a sign that there should be another cue there.

In this section you will be asked to find titles,subtitles, print and visual cues and make predictions about what you see. # Take a look at this book cover! # The title is located at the top, the visual cue of the babies in the middle and the subtitle the twins survival guide at the bottom.
The visual cue of the babies matches the subtitle but a picture of a burning building or dog would not. # I get it!
_user_, once you are comfortable with this idea of making sure the text signals make sense together, and with these sections of the book, click continue to keeo going.
Here is another question.
ok. # Here is another question!
_user_, Here is the last question for this section!
I hope you guys enjoyed this lesson with me!
Cristina, We did! # We learned how to identify text signals and make predictions.
Jordan,Yes you did! # You did so well with the text signals you just named. # Take a look at this recap of the sections so you have a final idea of title, subtitle, and visual cue.
Cristina, Thanks! # So, we learned that the text signals can provide us with more information when we try to make a prediction about a book or sign's topic and these text signals are shown below.
Yes you did learn that! # In later lessons you two will use this skill to help you make tougher predictions.
_user_, Great! # So we have to remember that text signals are very important and they help us make predictions.
_user_ and Jordan You got it! # I hope to see you soon! # Have a great day!
good bye. # See you next time.
I hope the lesson is helping you identify titles and subtitles, print and visual cues.
Here is the last question, Let's finish strong!
you guys are doing great with predictions and spotting your text signals. # Let's keep going.
I hope these questions are helping you.
I have two more questions for you. # Let's take a look now.
Here are more questions!
Here is another question!
You did a great job with the questions!

_user_ and Jordan! # You are half way through the lesson! # Here is more practice with identifying print and visual cues. # As you can see this book cover is similar to the example cover we saw in the beginning of the lesson about Back Pain.

Remember the title, What do do when you're having two, and it gives us general information about the book, # the visual cue of the babies supports the title, and subtitle,the twins survival guide, give more detailed information about the book. # When you are ready, click continue.
_user_ Hi. # I'm happy you are joining us for this lesson! # My name is Cristina and I will be your tutor throughout this program.
_user_, hello! # I'm Jordan! # I will be here learning with you! # I'm happy you are here to learn with me.
In this lesson we will show you how to identify print and visual cues, titles and subtitles. # Also, how to make predictions using these signals.
Cristina, Can you explain what these text signals are?

Yes. # Take a look at this book. # You can see the title of the book, Ending Back Pain; in green. # the visual cue of a person suffering from back pain is in yellow. # and the subtitle of the book is in blue.
I got it. # So the title gives us general information, the visual cue is related to the topic of the book, and the subtitle shows us more information about the topic. # Can we get started?
Yes, lets start. # But first, I should tell you that as we go along in the lessons, you may notice that two buttons appear at the bottom left of your screen.

These are a repeat button and a video button. # You can press the repeat button if you need to hear something again. # You can press the video button if you would like to review the video that highlights the lessons main points.
now, I think we are ready. # For this activity you will need to select the print cues or visual cues that complete the book cover or street sign.

From there you will have to make predictions about the material. # Let's look over the current book cover and take note of the different text signals. # When you are ready, please click on the continue button to start the activity.
Let's keep going!
Here is another question!
Let's keep going with these questions.
Here is another question. # Let's keep it up!
Here is the next section of the lesson!
Cristina, I think you have more questions for us!
Jordan, Yes I do. # Here is another.

Question.text: _user_, which of the following title options would you predict to be the best title, based on other cues on the book cover? # Click on the multiple choice options to the right to determine an answer. # The title of the book is not shown.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The book title that matches the other cues are Come to Me Softly.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt
Answer.text: Remember that a title reveals the general information about the topic of a book. # Look at the couple on the cover for help! # Can you pick the title of the book that fits the other cues?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: _user_ did you need more time to answer the question! # Try to pick the title that matches the other cues.

Answer.name: Assertion
Answer.text: the title of the book that is appropriate for the cover is Come to Me Softly.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, what do you think the title of the cover is?

Answer.name: JordanDisagree
Answer.text: I think the title of the book is 12 Breathing Techniques because they are breathing on each other!

Answer.name: JordanAgree
Answer.text: _user_, I think you picked the right answer. # Come to Me softly is the right title because of the couple on the cover.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerAgree
Answer.text: Yeah! # I knew we picked the right answer! # It is Come to Me softly. # The couple on the cover gives the answer away!

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand
Answer.text: I see, I was wrong. # I thought the answer was 12 Breathing techniques because it looked like they were doing CPR.

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand
Answer.text: I understand now, The title of the book is Come to Me softly. # This is supported by the couple on the cover.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerAgree

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand

Question.text: _user_ which text cue would be appropriate for the sign? # This means, which word below goes well with the rest of the sign.

Answer.text: The most appropriate text cue for the sign would be the word SLOW.

Answer.name: JordanAgree

Answer.name: JordanAnswerAgree

Answer.name: JordanDisagree

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand

Question.text: _user_ can you predict what the sign is telling you to do? # Use the context clues on the sign for help.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: This sign is telling us to drive slow because pedestrians are crossing the road.

Answer.name: IncorrectPrompt

Answer.name: AskJordan

Answer.name: JordanAgree
Answer.text: I think the sign is telling us to drive slow because people are crossing the street. # We don't want to cause accidents!

Answer.name: JordanAnswerAgree
Answer.text: we picked the best answer! # The sign is telling us to drive slow because people could be crossing the road.

Answer.name: JordanDisagree
Answer.text: I think the sign is telling us that this is a pedestrian walk way only and no cars are allowed to enter. # I think that is what this sign is telling us! # But then again, I don't know.

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand
Answer.text: I guess I wasn't right. # So the sign is telling us to drive slow and not that this is a pedestrian only walk way. # We just have to be careful when we drive.

Answer.name: JordanDisagree

Answer.name: JordanUnderstand

Answer.name: JordanAnswerUnderstand
